modus_ponens.description: If P then Q; P; therefore Q

modus_tollens.description: If P then Q; not Q; therefore not P

hypothetical_syllogism.description: If P then Q; if Q then R; therefore if P then R

disjunctive_syllogism.description: P or Q; not P; therefore Q

affirming_consequent.example: If it rains, the ground is wet; the ground is wet; therefore it rained (INVALID)

denying_antecedent.example: If it rains, the ground is wet; it didn't rain; therefore the ground is not wet (INVALID)
